availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Landrum (McLean County, Kentucky, hotel keeper)

body.p: McLean County, Kentucky, hotel keeper. Virginia native. Married Caroline W. Landrum. Father of Elizabeth Landrum, Henry C. Landrum, Thomas Landrum, Amma Landrum, Josephine Landrum, Martha V. Landrum, and Ruth F. Landrum. Hotel keeper in Daviess County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Daviess County in 1850. Hotel keeper in McLean County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in McLean County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 429A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, Calhoon, p. 4.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, Calhoon, p. 430A.
"James Landrum (1802-1870)," Find A Grave, Memorial #88229149, accessed August 9, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88229149.
